author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
Researchers at Osaka Metropolitan University have developed a method using stem cells derived from body fat to repair spinal fractures caused by osteoporosis. One these stem cells are formed into bone-promoting spheroids and combined with a biocompatible scaffold, they significantly enhance bone healing and restore spine strength in preclinical models.

Source Article: https://boneandjoint.org.uk/Article/10.1302/2046-3758.1410.BJR-2025-0092.R1
